body: FWIW, the behaviour ingame looks good. (You can count this as :+1: if above doesn't "trigger" "changes requested".)
Rebased.
Devastator has self heal up to 50% in orginal D2K.

@MustaphaTR : any chance you can compare the "Self Destruction" here ... with the original from d2000 ?  time till it explodes for example , damage output ... and the general feeling , anything that is missing ... any sounds ? or additional graphics ?
I will take a look to this when i back home. I'm at school now.

~~@MustaphaTR : i have a feeling that you could still "move" the vehicle , while the detonation was allready triggered ... i mean , you could move the vehicle while the countdown for the detonation has started ...~~ see below
No you can't. At least in orginal. Triggering detonation stops the vehicle.

I did some checks and found some problems. Damage looks too less in orginal only one Devastator can destroy can destroy a Power Plant/Barracks/Repair Deport. At OpenRA it doesn't even decrase its health to yellow.

Explosion anim also has some electricity things on it, not just normal explosion. Edit: I found the art file: 3947-3964

Not sure is it a problem but also current self destruct anim is translucent and makes it hard to see.

Also about AI with this, In orginal game if a Devastator changes its side with Deviator, or backs. AI usually but not always makes them self-destruct.

My inline comment may be missed, so i'll repeat again here: this feature is manually triggered, and does not use the targeting cursor, so it is not appropriate to implement this as an `Attack*` subclass.

Ideally it should use the same deploy-to-timed-upgrade logic as the saboteur cloak (with the timed upgrade stopping the vehicle and showing the animation, and then an upgrade at the end of the sequence triggering a KillsSelf trait).

I have to agree with @Mailaender though, while your way would be the best, it would look complicatzed in yaml and also would overcomplicate the PR as well. (Although I have to acknowledge it would also bring RA2 Crazy Ivans a step closer.) I'd even suggest wait with such until the Upgrade->Condition rename and conditional upgrades, iirc planned by @atlimit8.

A random idea - unsure on feasibility - that the deploy would fire a weapon instead which has the unit artwork via one warhead and have the explosion in another with the delay set in `SpreadDamageWarhead` with a custom `DeathType`, which could only kill the Devastator, thereby triggering an `Explodes` trait specific to this `DeathType`. Although I'm not sure if this is how D2k worked, asin deploying is only one-way and the unit cannot be moved thenafter.

Note that my comment was intentionally split into two parts.

The first is that `AttackDetonates` isn't appropriate for this feature, and comes with the changes requested tag.

The second is giving a constructive suggestion on how this could be done instead.  It doesn't _have_ to be done that way, but that is going to be the one of the few potential implementations that won't need to be replaced again in the future.

Oooor, we could look at the previous N discussions on the subject where I laid out an implementation plan that was _not_ "complicatzed in yaml and also would overcomplicate the PR"  :|

(Spoiler alert: I haven't read all of ^ or the PR details, but I felt I should mention there was already a plan, since this seems pretty controversial).

- correct damage-output (TibEd would have details on this values)
- correct explosion animation (3947-3964)
- fixing the less visible translucent self-destruct animation
- ~~only be available when the unit is at critical health~~

and you get a triple-A-thumbs-up from me

> - only be available when the unit is at critical health

What? Devastator self-destruct is avays available.

thats what pchote said " It should also only be available when the unit is at critical health." ... did sound reasonable to me ... 

if theres a reason to let it work that way ... im not against it , as it would only tightening the feature/rule and would require a little bit of attention on the execution
Aren't we still a bit early to do balance changes? I think we should add support of it but leave it as is.
fine , then without this restriction

> TibEd would have details on this values

Can you provide those? I don't have access to that program.
I am also running Linux. It doesn't have to be you.

I'm looking now. Wait a sec.

 Edit: Here  is a screenshot.
![devastator weapon](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7933210/13373171/a604fbae-dd68-11e5-8484-d53ba80da48b.png)

@MustaphaTR :

we probably need more then that ... 

check -> Explosions -> Ex_Devastator 

in the original -> place buildings (windtraps for example) around a Devastator ... look how far the damage spreads when he is self-destructing , and with what percentage of health buildings survive ... we should allready have the same hp as in the original (hopefully) ... 

we dont need the values 100% ... but roughly so the damage is close to the original ... you should be able to that visually by checking the original game ... making tests on various types of "armors" ... (you can read about the armor types in TibEd) ... then place a couple of tanks around the self destructing devstator -> what happens ? how many do survive ? in what range?  .. do the same with light vehicles in a wider radius ... same with infantry ... and buildings ... 

we should end up "atleast" with a good guess on max range and survivability of different armortypes

also @OmegaBolt or @reaperrr should be able to help here

I don't think we need that much testing. All other armor, versus, damage vaules macthes with orginal. We now know the damage we need. We just need to find a good falloff: vaule for explosion that looks like orginal.

Edit: Here is Warhead. Explosion is just animation and sounds, there is no imprtant stuff there. @Mailaender these doesn't match with yours here. Its versus needs to be changed.

![devastator explosion warhead](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7933210/13373821/715a356a-dd7a-11e5-9f74-2b5cbccc2539.png)

oh , yeah sry ... i did'nt check the screenshot correctly ... so the damage is 5000  ... and the range is 96 ...air - carryalls , arent effected

but why a "fallout-value" ?
I meant `Falloff:` How the damage decrases by range may be different with this and orginal and this is what this tag controls. This is possibly hardcoded in D2K tho, so we can't understand easily.

In the original game the damage isn't dealt like a normal warhead detonation using falloff, it uses a YR style shrapnel system IIRC. When the Devastator explodes it "infects" a certain number of random targets around the vehicle that take the damage.
Closing this for now to clear the PR queue.
Superseded by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13884.
